note: 亚马逊迄今为止最受期待的原创作品之一，尚未命名的《指环王》原创系列，将于 2022 年 9 月 2 日星期五在 Prime Video 上正式亮相。随着首映日期的确定，亚马逊工作室发布了即将上映的官方第一张图片系列，以中土世界的第二纪元为背景。该系列将发生在 JRR Tolkien 的《霍比特人》和《指环王》两本书中记载的事件之前数千年，它将跟随“熟悉的和新的角色，因为他们面临着长期担心的邪恶再次出现到中东-地球。”在新西兰拍摄后，图像发布与该系列的制作包装有关。粉丝们很快推测该系列将以维林诺为背景，因为图像描绘了似乎是两棵树的东西。这个未命名的项目是亚马逊对其 Prime Video 流媒体服务的巨额投资。据报道，该系列的第一季制作成本约为 4.65 亿美元。对于亚马逊工作室来说，这个系列是一项巨大的创意工作，据报道，《权力的游戏》最后一季每集的成本高达 1500 万美元（尽管其预算最初约为每集 500 万美元）。该系列的主要演员包括辛西娅·阿戴-罗宾逊、罗伯特·阿拉马约、欧文·亚瑟、马克西姆·鲍德里、纳赞宁·博尼亚迪、莫菲德·克拉克、伊斯梅尔·克鲁兹·科尔多瓦、查尔斯·爱德华兹、特里斯坦·格拉维尔、莱尼·亨利爵士、埃玛·霍瓦特、马克拉·卡维纳、约瑟夫·马勒、 Tyroe Muhafidin、Sophia Nomvete、Lloyd Owen、Megan Richards、Dylan Smith、Charlie Vickers、Leon Wadham、Benjamin Walker、Daniel Weyman 和 Sara Zwangobani。 Showrunners JD Payne 和 Patrick McKay 是该节目的执行制作人。 “正如比尔博所说，'现在我想我已经准备好开始另一段旅程了，'”佩恩和麦凯在一份联合声明中说。 “在中土生活和呼吸这几个月是一生的冒险。我们迫不及待地希望粉丝们也有机会这样做。”该系列将于明年在 Prime Video 上播出时在 240 多个地区和国家首映。
note_en:
One of Amazon’s most anticipated originals to date, a yet-unnamed  Lord of the Rings original series, will officially debut on Prime Video on Friday, September 2nd, 2022.
 Along with a premiere date, Amazon Studios released an official first image from the forthcoming series, which will be set in Middle-earth’s Second Age. The series will take place thousands of years before the events chronicled in J. R. R. Tolkien’s  The Hobbit and  The Lord of the Rings books, and it will follow characters “both familiar and new, as they confront the long-feared re-emergence of evil to Middle-earth.”
 The image release is tied to the series’s production wrap after filming in New Zealand. Fans  quickly speculated that the series will be set in Valinor, as the image depicts what appear to be the Two Trees.
 The untitled project is a huge investment by Amazon in its Prime Video streaming service. The series’s first season alone reportedly  cost around $465 million to produce. For context about what a massive creative undertaking this series has been for Amazon Studios, the final season of  Game of Thrones was reported to have cost as much as  $15 million per episode (though its budget was originally around $5 million per episode).
 The headlining cast of the series includes Cynthia Addai-Robinson, Robert Aramayo, Owain Arthur, Maxim Baldry, Nazanin Boniadi, Morfydd Clark, Ismael Cruz Córdova, Charles Edwards, Trystan Gravelle, Sir Lenny Henry, Ema Horvath, Markella Kavenagh, Joseph Mawle, Tyroe Muhafidin, Sophia Nomvete, Lloyd Owen, Megan Richards, Dylan Smith, Charlie Vickers, Leon Wadham, Benjamin Walker, Daniel Weyman, and Sara Zwangobani. Showrunners J.D. Payne and Patrick McKay are executive producing the show.
 “As Bilbo says, ‘Now I think I am quite ready to go on another journey,’” Payne and McKay said in a joint statement. “Living and breathing Middle-earth these many months has been the adventure of a lifetime. We cannot wait for fans to have the chance to do so as well.”
 The series will premiere in more than 240 territories and countries when it arrives on Prime Video next year.
title: 亚马逊的指环王系列将于 2022 年 9 月首播
title_en: Amazon's Lord of the Rings Series Will Premiere In September 2022

note: 我们已经看到可以发现脑肿瘤的头盔和人工智能，但一种新的安全帽实际上也可以治疗它们。作为最新神经学突破的一部分，研究人员使用头盔产生磁场将致命肿瘤缩小三分之一。接受治疗的 53 岁患者最终因无关的伤害去世。但是，对他的大脑进行的尸检显示，该手术在短时间内切除了 31% 的肿瘤块。该测试标志着第一种针对称为胶质母细胞瘤的致命脑癌的无创疗法。头盔的特点是三个旋转磁铁连接到一个由可充电电池操作的基于微处理器的电子控制器。作为治疗的一部分，患者在诊所佩戴该设备五周，然后在妻子的帮助下回家。头盔产生的磁场疗法最初进行了两个小时，然后逐渐增加到每天最多六个小时。在此期间，患者的肿瘤质量和体积缩小了近三分之一，缩小似乎与治疗剂量相关。该设备的发明者——获得了 FDA 的同情使用治疗的批准——声称它有朝一日可以帮助治疗脑癌，而无需放疗或化疗。 “我们的结果……开启了一个无创和无毒治疗的新世界……未来有许多令人兴奋的可能性，”Kenneth R. Peak 脑和垂体中心的通讯作者兼主任 David S. Baskin 说休斯顿卫理公会神经病学研究所神经外科的肿瘤治疗。该程序的详细信息已发表在同行评审的肿瘤学前沿杂志上。 Engadget 推荐的所有产品均由我们的编辑团队选择，独立于我们的母公司。我们的一些故事包括附属链接。如果您通过这些链接之一购买商品，我们可能会赚取会员佣金。由于您的隐私偏好，此内容不可用。在此处更新您的设置，然后重新加载页面以查看它。
note_en:
We've seen  helmets and  AI that can spot brain tumors, but a new hard hat can actually treat them, too. As part of the latest neurological  breakthrough, researchers used a helmet that generates a magnetic field to shrink a deadly tumor by a third. The 53-year-old patient who underwent the treatment ultimately passed away due to an unrelated injury. But, an autopsy of his brain showed that the procedure had removed 31 percent of the tumor mass in a short time. The test marked the first noninvasive therapy for a deadly form of brain cancer known as glioblastoma.
 The helmet features three rotating magnets connected to a microprocessor-based electronic controller operated by a rechargeable battery. As part of the therapy, the patient wore the device for five weeks at a clinic and then at home with the help of his wife. The resulting magnetic field therapy created by the helmet was administered for two hours initially and then ramped up to a maximum of six hours per day. During the period, the patient's tumor mass and volume shrunk by nearly a third, with shrinkage appearing to correlate with the treatment dose.
  The inventors of the device — which received FDA approval for compassionate use treatment — claim it could one day help treat brain cancer without radiation or chemotherapy. “Our results...open a new world of non-invasive and nontoxic therapy...with many exciting possibilities for the future,” said David S. Baskin, corresponding author and director of the Kenneth R. Peak Center for Brain and Pituitary Tumor Treatment in the Department of Neurosurgery at Houston Methodist Neurological Institute. Details of the procedure have been published in the peer-reviewed journal  Frontiers in Oncology.

title: 磁性头盔在世界首次测试中缩小了致命的肿瘤
title_en: A Magnetic Helmet Shrunk a Deadly Tumor In World-First Test

note: 本周早些时候，微软推出了新的云 PC Windows 365 服务，由于需求，该公司已经不得不暂停免费试用。 Windows 365 可让您租用云 PC（配备各种 CPU、RAM 和存储选项），然后通过 Web 浏览器流式传输 Windows 10 或 Windows 11。该服务仅在注册一天后就达到了最大容量。 Microsoft 365 Twitter 帐户的声明中写道：“随着大量需求，我们已经达到了 Windows 365 试用的容量。” “我们看到了对 Windows 365 的令人难以置信的反响，需要在我们提供额外容量的同时暂停我们的免费试用计划，”Windows 365 计划管理总监 Scott Manchester 解释说。 Windows 365 目前仅适用于企业，如果该公司在免费试用一天后就遇到了容量问题，那么其需求显然超出了微软的预期。微软周一推出了这项服务，如果您已经拥有 Windows 10 许可证，则每个用户的定价为一个 vCPU、2GB 内存、64GB 存储和 12GB 带宽的每月 20 美元起。 Windows 365 有多种配置，包括高端配置，包括 8 个 vCPU、32GB 内存和 512GB 存储空间，每月 158 美元。 Windows365.com 上提供了所有不同的价格选项，但您现在需要注册免费试用，因为 Microsoft 已达到容量上限。
note_en:
Microsoft launched its new cloud PC Windows 365 service  earlier this week, and the company has already had to pause free trials due to demand.  Windows 365 lets you rent a cloud PC — with a variety of CPU, RAM, and storage options — and then stream Windows 10 or Windows 11 via a web browser. The service reached max capacity after only a day of signups.
 “Following significant demand, we have reached capacity for Windows 365 trials,” reads a statement from the Microsoft 365 Twitter account. “We have seen unbelievable response to Windows 365 and need to pause our free trial program while we provision additional capacity,”  explains Scott Manchester, director of Windows 365 program management.
   Windows 365 is only available to businesses right now, and there’s clearly been more demand than Microsoft had anticipated if the company has hit capacity issues after just a day of free trials. Microsoft launched the service on Monday, with per-user pricing that starts at $20 per month for one vCPU, 2GB of RAM, 64GB of storage, and 12GB of bandwidth if you already have a Windows 10 license.
 There are a variety of configurations for Windows 365, including one at the top end that includes eight vCPUs, 32GB of RAM, and 512GB of storage for $158 per month. All of the different price options are available at  Windows365.com, but you’ll now need to  register interest in a free trial as Microsoft has hit capacity.
title: 微软暂停其新 Windows 365 服务的免费试用，该服务允许用户在“大量需求”后通过网络浏览器流式传输 Windows 10 或 11
title_en: Microsoft pauses free trials of its new Windows 365 service, which lets users stream Windows 10 or 11 via web browser, after “significant demand”

黑客。虚假信息。监视。 CYBER 是 Motherboard 的播客，报道了互联网的阴暗面。根据 Motherboard 获得的一份谷歌内部文件，谷歌在 2018 年至 2020 年期间解雇了数十名员工，原因是他们滥用了对公司工具或数据的访问权限，其中一些员工可能面临访问谷歌用户或员工数据的指控。该文件提供了关于科技巨头运营中一个通常很微妙的部分的具体数据：调查公司自己的员工如何利用他们的职位来窃取、泄露或滥用他们可能访问的数据。内部人员滥用是整个科技行业的一个问题。 Motherboard 之前在 Facebook、Snapchat 和 MySpace 上发现了一些实例，在某些情况下，员工会利用他们的访问权来跟踪或以其他方式监视用户。该文件称，谷歌在 2020 年因安全相关问题解雇了 36 名员工。在针对员工的所有与安全相关的指控中，86% 包括对机密信息处理不当，例如将仅供内部使用的信息传输给外部各方。该文件显示，2020 年所有指控中有 10% 涉及滥用系统，其中可能包括违反谷歌自己的政策访问用户或员工数据、帮助他人访问该数据，或者修改或删除用户或员工数据。 2019 年，这一数字占所有安全指控的 13%。您是否知道有任何公司员工利用他们对用户数据的访问权限？我们很乐意听取您的意见。使用非工作电话或计算机，您可以通过 +44 20 8133 5190 上的 Signal、josephcox 上的 Wickr 或电子邮件 joseph.cox@vice.com 安全地联系 Joseph Cox。提供文件的人士告诉 Motherboard，谷歌在 2019 年解雇了 26 名员工，2018 年解雇了 18 名与安全事件相关的员工。主板允许此人匿名更坦率地谈论 Google 问题。该文件称，谷歌可以对数据处理不当的员工采取的其他措施包括警告、培训和辅导。
谷歌发言人在一份声明中告诉 Motherboard：“所提到的情况主要与对专有和敏感的公司信息或 IP 的不当访问或滥用有关。” “关于用户数据，我们通过多项行业领先的保护措施严格限制员工访问，包括：将用户数据的访问权限限制为必要的个人、要求提供访问此类数据的理由、在授予敏感数据访问权限之前进行多阶段审查，以及监控访问异常和违规行为，”声明补充说。 “无论是有意还是无意，违规的数量一直很低。每位员工每年都接受培训，我们调查所有指控，违规会导致纠正措施，包括解雇。我们在公开调查的数量和结果方面是透明的我们的员工，并制定了严格的流程来保护客户和用户数据免受任何内部或外部威胁。” Gawker 当时报道称，2010 年，谷歌解雇了工程师大卫·巴克斯代尔 (David Barksdale)，理由是他利用他作为技术小组成员的职位访问了四名未成年人的账户。报告补充说，巴克斯代尔访问了一名 15 岁男孩的谷歌语音通话记录，以及联系人列表和聊天记录，并解除了与一名与他断绝联系的青少年的联系。
note_en:
Hacking. Disinformation. Surveillance. CYBER is Motherboard's podcast and reporting on the dark underbelly of the internet.
  Google fired dozens of employees between 2018 and 2020 for abusing their access to the company's tools or data, with some workers potentially facing allegations of accessing Google user or employee data, according to an internal Google document obtained by Motherboard.
  The document provides concrete figures on an often delicate part of a tech giant's operations: investigations into how the company's own employees leverage their positions to steal, leak, or abuse data they may have access to. Insider abuse is a problem across the tech industry. Motherboard previously  uncovered instances at Facebook,  Snapchat,  and MySpace, with employees in some cases using their access to stalk or otherwise spy on users.
    The document says that Google terminated 36 employees in 2020 for security-related issues. Eighty-six percent of all security-related allegations against employees included mishandling of confidential information, such as the transfer of internal-only information to outside parties.
  Ten percent of all allegations in 2020 concerned misuse of systems, which can include accessing user or employee data in violation of Google's own policies, helping others to access that data, or modifying or deleting user or employee data, according to the document. In 2019, that figure was 13 percent of all security allegations.
 Do you know about any company employees leveraging their access to user data? We'd love to hear from you. Using a non-work phone or computer, you can contact Joseph Cox securely on Signal on +44 20 8133 5190, Wickr on josephcox, or email joseph.cox@vice.com.
  Google terminated 26 people in 2019 and 18 in 2018 related to security incidents, the person who provided the document told Motherboard. Motherboard granted the person anonymity to speak more candidly about Google issues. The document says that other measures Google can take with employees that mishandled data can include warnings, training, and coaching.
  A Google spokesperson told Motherboard in a statement: "The instances referred to mostly relate to inappropriate access to, or misuse of, proprietary and sensitive corporate information or IP."
  "Regarding user data, we tightly restrict employee access through a number of industry leading safeguards, including: limiting access to user data to necessary individuals, requiring a justification to access such data, multi-stage review before access is granted to sensitive data, and monitoring for access anomalies and violations," the statement added. "The number of violations, whether deliberate or inadvertent, is consistently low. Every employee gets training annually, we investigate all allegations, and violations result in corrective action up to and including termination. We are transparent in publicizing the number and outcome of our investigations to our employees and have strict processes in place to secure customer and user data from any internal or external threats."
  In 2010, Google fired engineer David Barksdale for leveraging his position as a member of a technical group to access the accounts of four minors,   Gawker  reported at the time. Barksdale accessed a 15-year-old boy's Google Voice call logs, as well as contact lists and chat transcripts and unblocked himself from a teen who had cut communications with him, the report added.
title: 内部文件：谷歌在 2018 年至 2020 年期间解雇了数十名工程师滥用他们对数据和工具的访问
title_en: Internal document: Google fired dozens of engineers between 2018 and 2020 for abusing their access to data and tools

当 Superhuman 首席执行官 Rahul Vohra 同意与前 Dropbox 首席财务官 Ajay Vashee 的风险投资公司 IVP 会面，讨论对他的电子邮件生产力初创公司的投资时，这位企业家有一个条件：没有团体演示。对于许多初创公司来说，在周一的会议上推介一家风险投资公司的合作伙伴关系是一种成人礼。 Vohra 说他会与每个合作伙伴会面，以一对一的方式谈论 Superhuman。 “我讨厌走进办公室，在会议室里说，'这是我的甲板，' 敲桌子说'rah rah rah'，这是我的愿景。我不是美国创始人，我是一个非常低调的英国人，个性明智，”沃拉说。 “那只是我的文化。” Vohra 的方式花了更多的时间——Vashee 承认 IVP 不太可能让它成为它看到的每家初创公司的标准——但它得到了回报，因为 Superhuman 已经筹集了由 IVP 牵头的 7500 万美元的 C 轮融资。据知情人士透露，该轮融资包括 Tiger Global 和 Discord 和 Dropbox 首席执行官的个人投资以及其他一批人，对 Superhuman 的估值为 8.25 亿美元。这种定制方法也是 Vohra 和联合创始人 Conrad Irwin 和 Vivek Sodera 将 Superhuman 构建成一个软件应用程序的典型方式，该软件应用程序的候补名单超过 450,000。 Superhuman 成立于 2014 年，从未正式上线；到目前为止，只有 Gmail 和 iOS 用户从该列表中删除，他们必须通过 30 分钟的实时入职培训，才能获得每月支付 30 美元的特权，以获得许多其他免费提供的服务、电子邮件。它的价格和礼宾服务让 Superhuman 很容易被硅谷精英视为一种小奢侈品。但它允许 Superhuman 谨慎地增长，主要是靠自己的收入，同时从反馈开始调整其工具（杀手级功能：键盘快捷键，可以轻松回复预先编写的消息或模板、缩放链接和日历保留）用户第一次探索产品的那一刻。 Superhuman 没有分享其用户总数（在 2020 年，福布斯估计 Superhuman 在该初创公司出现在下一个十亿美元初创公司名单时已达到至少 50,000）。该公司确实表示，迄今为止，这些客户已经发送了超过 1 亿条消息来“分类”超过 3.35 亿个对话；在过去两年中，超过一半的月度用户每天都在使用该应用程序（并且超过 60%，不包括周末）。 Vohra 补充说，58% 的用户每天在该应用程序上花费的时间超过 3 小时（根据 Adob​​e 的一项调查，与普通员工在工作日在电子邮件上花费的时间相当），并且平均向其他人发送了 3.4 个邀请，在六个月内将至少一个人转化为客户。 “他们有志于成为工作场所沟通和生产力的实际领导者，并获得用户许可，”Vashee 说。看到 Dropbox 如何从个人用户自下而上扩展到企业的相似之处，IVP 投资者也将 Vohra 与他的一些前同事联系起来； Dropbox 首席执行官 Drew Houston 和联合创始人 Arash Ferdowsi 都亲自投资，总裁 Timothy Young 也是如此。 Young 的假设：电子邮件仍然是许多员工开始一天工作的地方。但是，向远程工作的转变已经消除了花费数小时检查电子邮件以在办公室环境中看起来富有成效的剧院，从而提高了效率和“高度自以为是的工作流程”。
Vohra 说，尽管在 2019 年由 Andreessen Horowitz 领导的 B 系列筹集了 3300 万美元，但 Superhuman 在获得新资金之前仍然有 3000 万美元在银行里。这笔资金将立即投入到该初创公司为 Android 和 Outlook 用户开放服务的持续推动中，这些用户代表了其大部分候补名单和前两项功能请求。在明年推出之前，前十名左右的测试人员已经在尝试早期版本的 Superhuman 的 Outlook 兼容服务；据 Vohra 称，Superhuman 的人数目前约为 85 人，到今年年底将达到约 120 人，到 2022 年底将达到 200 多人。多达一半的员工正在招募新用户并观察他们； Superhuman 的 CEO 表示，大部分时间里，Superhuman 的增长已被其可用性最大化。这可能很快就会改变，因为现在约有 5% 到 10% 的新用户通过 Superhuman 网站上为精通技术的采用者提供的测试自助服务选项进入。 Discord 的首席执行官 Jason Citron 在 1 月份以这种方式加入，而 Vohra 并不知道，然后才承诺在 6 月份进行投资。当然，减轻候补名单上的压力有利于 Superhuman 的底线——并有助于消除它作为科技行业必备工具的任何内涵。该公司已经通过招聘新的高管来推动企业销售； Vohra 说，超过一半的 Superhuman 许可证已经由雇主直接或通过费用支付，企业客户的净保留率在 130% 到 180% 之间波动。但是 Superhuman 可以通过日历工具和与其他工作应用程序的集成做更多的事情；该公司还计划添加基本任务管理等功能以将电子邮件分配给同事，以及自动更正和其他写作辅助工具以加快撰写电子邮件的速度。 Superhuman 建立在已有数十年历史的电子邮件客户端技术之上，必须在不降低其体验的情况下完成所有这些工作，这也是一个技术难题。 Superhuman 现在还包括 Thrive Global 首席执行官 Arianna Huffington、Brex 联合首席执行官 Henrique Dubugras、演员 Ashton Kutcher、Mila Kunis 和 Will Smith、音乐团体 The Chainsmokers 和一些职业运动员，其人数超过 150 人。作为一名狂热的投资者，Vohra 说他们可以帮助 Superhuman 扩展到新行业——Vohra 正在与赫芬顿合作，探讨如何将 Superhuman 纳入 Thrive 以健康为导向的公司关系——但也允许 Superhuman 团队向同样致力于效率和卓越的领导者学习在自己的领域。让电子邮件变得更少是 Superhuman 今天的既定使命。它远不是唯一一家解决这个问题的公司。 Vohra 本人之前曾将一家电子邮件初创公司 Rapportive 出售给了 LinkedIn，而 Dropbox 收购了另一家 Mailbox，该公司后来倒闭了。 Vohra 的希望是 Superhuman 有机会通过逐渐成长，然后突然“跨越鸿沟”走出湾区和科技行业，从协作应用程序 Slack 的剧本中汲取一页。用一只眼睛，Vohra 已经在关注 Superhuman 在消息应用程序和像 Slack 这样的实时通信方面的未来。 “我认为我们不会永远是一家电子邮件公司，”他说。
note_en:
When Superhuman CEO Rahul Vohra agreed to meet with former Dropbox CFO Ajay Vashee’s venture capital firm IVP about an investment in his email productivity startup, the entrepreneur had one condition: no group presentation. For many startups, pitching a VC firm’s partnership during its Monday meetings is a rite of passage. Vohra said he’d meet with each and every partner to talk about Superhuman one-on-one instead.
   “I hate coming into the office, being in a boardroom and saying, ‘Here’s my deck,’ pounding the table about ‘rah rah rah,’ my vision. I’m not an American founder, I’m a very understated British type, personality wise,” Vohra says. “That’s just my culture.”
 Vohra’s way took many more hours – Vashee admits IVP is unlikely to make it standard for every startup it sees – but it paid off, as Superhuman has raised a $75 million Series C funding round led by IVP. The round, which included Tiger Global and personal investments from the CEOs of Discord and Dropbox and a bevy of others, values Superhuman at $825 million, according to a source with knowledge of the transaction.
 That bespoke approach is also typical of how Vohra and cofounders Conrad Irwin and Vivek Sodera have built Superhuman into a software app with a waitlist of more than 450,000. Founded in 2014, Superhuman has never formally launched; customers, Gmail and iOS users only so far, who make it off that list must go through a 30-minute live onboarding session for the privilege to pay $30 per month for a service, email, offered by many others for free.
 Its price point and concierge service makes Superhuman easy to dismiss as a small luxury for the Silicon Valley elite. But it’s allowed Superhuman to grow cautiously, largely off its own revenue, all while tweaking its tools (the killer feature: keyboard shortcuts that can make it easy to reply with pre-written messages or templates, Zoom links and calendar holds) from feedback starting the moment a user first explores the product.
  Superhuman doesn’t share its total number of users (in 2020,  Forbes estimated Superhuman had reached at least 50,000 when the startup appeared on the list of  Next Billion Dollar Startups). The company does say those customer have sent more than 100 million messages to “triage” more than 335 million conversations to date; more than half of monthly users have worked in the app daily for the past two years (and more than 60% excluding weekends). Vohra adds that 58% of users spend more than 3 hours per day in the app (on par with what the average worker already spends on email in a weekday,  per an Adobe survey), and have sent an average of 3.4 invites to others, converting at least one person into a customer, within six months.
 “They have the ambition, as well as the user permission, to become a de facto leader in workplace communication and productivity,” says Vashee. Seeing parallels to how Dropbox spread bottoms-up from individual users into businesses, the IVP investor connected Vohra to some of his former colleagues, too; Dropbox CEO Drew Houston and cofounder Arash Ferdowsi both personally invested, as did president Timothy Young. Young’s hypothesis: email is still where many workers start their day. But the shift to remote work has stripped away the theater of spending hours checking email to look productive in an office setting, placing a premium on efficiency and “hyper-opinionated workflows.”
   Despite raising $33 million in a Series B led by Andreessen Horowitz  in 2019, Superhuman still had $30 million in the bank ahead of its new funding, Vohra says. The money will be poured immediately into the startup’s ongoing push to open up its service for Android and Outlook users, who represent much of its waitlist and its top two feature requests. The first ten or so testers are already trying an early version of Superhuman’s Outlook-compatible service ahead of its availability next year; Superhuman’s head count, today around 85, will reach about 120 by end of year and 200-plus by the end of 2022, according to Vohra.
 Up to about half of those staff are onboarding new users and observing them; most weeks, Superhuman’s growth has been maxed out by their availability, its CEO says. That could be changing soon, as about 5% to 10% of new users are now coming in through a test self-service option on Superhuman’s site for tech-savvy adopters. Discord CEO Jason Citron came in that way in January, unbeknownst to Vohra, before committing to invest in June.
 Alleviating the pressure on its waitlist would, of course, be good for Superhuman’s bottom line—and help eliminate any connotation it has as a nice-to-have tool for the tech industry. Already, the company is pushing into enterprise sales with new executive hires; more than half of Superhuman licenses are already paid for by employers directly or through expensing, Vohra says, with net retention of corporate customers fluctuating between 130% and 180%.
 But Superhuman could do more with calendar tools and integrations with other work apps; the company also plans to add features like basic task management to assign emails to colleagues, as well as auto-correct and other writing assistance tools to make composing emails faster. Built on decades-old email client technology, Superhuman must do all that without slowing down its experience, too, a technical puzzle.
  Superhuman now also counts Thrive Global CEO Arianna Huffington, Brex co-CEO Henrique Dubugras, actors Ashton Kutcher, Mila Kunis and Will Smith, music group The Chainsmokers and some professional athletes among its cap table of more than 150 individuals. An  avid investor himself, Vohra says they can help Superhuman expand into new industries—Vohra is working with Huffington about ways to incorporate Superhuman into Thrive’s wellness-oriented corporate relationships—but also allows the Superhuman team to learn from leaders similarly committed to efficiency and excellence in their own fields.
 Making email suck less is Superhuman’s stated mission today. It’s  far from the only company to tackle that problem; Vohra himself previously sold an email startup, Rapportive, to LinkedIn, while Dropbox acquired another, Mailbox,  that later withered, among others. Vohra’s hope is that Superhuman has a shot to take a page out of collaboration app Slack’s playbook by growing gradually, then suddenly, “crossing the chasm” out of the Bay Area and tech industry.
 With one eye, Vohra’s already looking at Superhuman’s future in messaging apps and real-time communications like Slack. “I don’t think we will remain an email company forever,” he says.
title: 电子邮件服务 Superhuman 每月收费 30 美元，尚未正式推出，在 IVP 领投的 C 轮融资中筹集了 7500 万美元，消息人士称估值为 8.25 亿美元
title_en: Email service Superhuman, which charges $30/month and hasn't formally launched, raises $75M Series C led by IVP, source says at a $825M valuation
